title: 107_hr2915
content: The Act may be cited as the "Public Safety and Cyber Security Enhancement Act of 2001" and includes provisions for the interception of communications. The Act, known as the "Public Safety and Cyber Security Enhancement Act of 2001," includes definitions for 'protected computer' and 'computer trespasser,' as well as exceptions allowing interception of communications of a computer trespasser by a person acting under color of law. The Act, named the "Public Safety and Cyber Security Enhancement Act of 2001," permits interception of a computer trespasser's communications under specific conditions, including authorization by the owner, lawful investigation, relevance to the investigation, and limited acquisition of communications. The Act allows interception of communications from computer trespassers under certain conditions, including authorization by the owner, lawful investigation, relevance to the investigation, and limited acquisition of communications. Amendments include expanding the scope to include electronic communications and clarifying that voluntary or obligatory disclosures of information are not restricted, except for revealing customer cable television viewing activity. SEC. 3. PEN REGISTERS AND TRAP AND TRACE DEVICES. Section 3121(c) of title 18, United States Code is amended to include the use of a trap and trace device, and the processing and transmitting of wire and electronic communications. Section 3123(a) is also amended to authorize the installation and use of a pen register or trap and trace device upon application and certification by the Government attorney. The court can authorize the installation and use of a pen register or trap and trace device for ongoing criminal investigations if relevant information is certified by law enforcement. This order applies to any entity providing communication services in the US. The legislation amends Section 3123(b)(1) of title 18, United States Code, to include additional details for criminal investigations, such as the attributes of communications and facilities involved. The legislation further amends Section 3123(d)(2) of title 18, United States Code, to include provisions for emergency pen registers and trap and trace devices. The legislation amends Section 3125(a) of title 18, US Code to include provisions for emergency pen registers and trap and trace devices. It also updates definitions in Section 3127(2)(A) related to district courts. The legislation updates definitions related to district courts in Section 3127(2)(A) of title 18, US Code, regarding pen registers. The legislation amends Section 3127 of title 18, US Code, to update definitions related to devices used for cost accounting in wire communication services. It also expands the definition of a device to include processes, and clarifies information relevant to identifying the source of a wire or electronic communication. Additionally, the term 'protected computer' is defined in line with section 1030 of the title.
